instructions: Participants were presented with information about birth sequences and asked to estimate the frequency of a specific sequence based on a given standard.

items.question: All families of six children in a city were surveyed. In 72 families the exact order of births of boys and girls was G B G B B G. What is your estimate of the number of families surveyed in which the exact order of births was B G B B B B?
Participants were asked to compare the likelihood of two birth sequences: B B B G G G and G B B G B G.
